de.esoco.entity

Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • org.obrel.core.SerializableRelatedObject
        • de.esoco.entity.Entity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.esoco.storage.AfterStoreHandler, java.io.Serializable, org.obrel.core.Relatable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Configuration, ExtraAttribute, HistoryRecord, LogEntry, PeriodEntity

    public class Entity
extends org.obrel.core.SerializableRelatedObject
implements de.esoco.storage.AfterStoreHandler
    The base class for persistent entities that are created from entity definitions. It can either be used directly or subclassed for entity classes that want to provide additional methods. But all standard attributes from the definition can be accessed directly with the Relatable methods.

    Besides the standard attributes from the entity definition an entity can have arbitrary extra attributes which will only be stored if they are set on an entity. These extra attributes can be set and retrieved with the methods getExtraAttribute(RelationType, Object) and setExtraAttribute(RelationType, Object).

    Extra attribute relation types must be created through the factory methods in the class ExtraAttributes because any other kind of relation type in an entity will be recognized as a standard attribute when analyzed by EntityDefinition.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setAttributeDisplayProperty

        public static <T> void setAttributeDisplayProperty(java.lang.Class<? extends Entity> rEntityClass,
                                                   de.esoco.lib.property.PropertyName<T> rProperty,
                                                   T rValue,
                                                   org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>... rAttributes)
        Helper method for subclasses to set a display property on attributes. If the attribute doesn't have display attributes yet they will be created and stored in the EntityRelationTypes.DISPLAY_PROPERTIES relation.

        ATTENTION: this setting affects all occurrences of the given attribute. Properties of attributes that are re-used in different contexts (e.g. relation types defined in StandardTypes or similar) should be set with a EntityDefinition.ATTRIBUTE_DISPLAY_PROPERTIES_FIELD instead to prevent side effects.

        Parameters:
        rEntityClass - The entity class for which to set the property
        rProperty - The property to set
        rValue - The property values
        rAttributes - The attributes to set the display property on

      • addChild

        public final <C extends Entity> void addChild(org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.util.List<C>> rChildAttr,
                                              C rChild)
        A convenience method to add a single child to an entity. Invokes the method addChildren(RelationType, Entity...) .
        Parameters:
        rChildAttr - The attribute that references the child type
        rChild - The child object to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If one of the parameters is invalid or if the child is already stored in this entity

      • addChildren

        public final <C extends Entity> void addChildren(org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.util.List<C>> rChildAttr,
                                                 C... rChildren)
        A convenience method to add variable number of children to an entity. Invokes the method addChildren(RelationType, List).
        Parameters:

        rChildren - The new child objects to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If one of the parameters is invalid or if one of the children is already stored in this entity

      • addChildren

        public <C extends Entity> void addChildren(org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.util.List<C>> rChildAttr,
                                           java.util.List<C> rChildren)
        Adds child entities to this entity. This will set the parent references in the children to this instance. If a child already exists in this entity an exception will be thrown. It is recommended that entity children are always added through this method unless an entity subclass implements (and documents) more specific methods for the management of child entities.
        Parameters:
        rChildAttr - The attribute that references the child type
        rChildren - The new child objects to add to this entity
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If one of the parameters is invalid or if one of the children is already stored in this entity

                throws java.lang.Exception

      • appendAttribute

        public void appendAttribute(java.lang.StringBuilder rStringBuilder,
                            org.obrel.core.RelationType<?> rAttribute,
                            java.lang.String sFormat,
                            boolean bIncludeNull)
        A method that appends a string description of a certain attribute to a StringBuilder. The attribute description will appended as defined by the given format string which must contain two %s references. The first one will be replaced by the attribute name after converting it with the method TextConvert.capitalize(String, String) and the second is replaced with the attribute value Object.toString(). NULL values will only be included if the boolean parameter is TRUE. Otherwise no attribute description will be appended at all.
        Parameters:
        rStringBuilder - The string builder to append the attribute description to
        rAttribute - The relation type of the attribute to append
        sFormat - The format string for the formatting of the attribute name and value
        bIncludeNull - TRUE to include NULL values, FALSE to omit them

      • attributeString

        sSeparator - The separator string between attributes
        Returns:

      • attributeString

        public java.lang.String attributeString(java.util.List<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>> rAttributes,
                                        java.lang.String sSeparator)
        Creates a string for a certain list of entity attributes. NULL values will be omitted from the output.
        Parameters:

        sSeparator - The separator string between attributes
        Returns:
        The resulting string

      • checkForHierarchyUpdate

        public Entity checkForHierarchyUpdate()
        This method can be overridden by subclasses to check if the instance's hierarchy needs an update. In such a case the method should return the topmost parent of the hierarchy which needs to be stored to make all changes persistent. Otherwise it should return itself to continue with the standard update. The default implementation returns the topmost parent entity in this entity's hierarchy that has been marked with the MetaTypes.MODIFIED flag.
        Returns:
        The topmost entity in the hierarchy to update or THIS

      • collectDownwards

        public <E extends Entity> java.util.List<E> collectDownwards(org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.util.List<E>> rChildAttribute,
                                                             de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<? super E> pCriteria)
        Collects all children of a certain type in the hierarchy of this entity that match a certain predicate.
        Parameters:
        rChildAttribute - The child attribute to descend the hierarchy at
        pCriteria - The predicate to evaluate the child entities with
        Returns:
        A new list containing the resulting child entities (may be empty but will never be NULL)

      • createChangeDescription

        public java.lang.String createChangeDescription()
        Creates a JSON string containing the modified values of this entity and it's hierarchy. Value changes are recorded by the entity modification tracking with annotations of type StandardTypes.PREVIOUS_VALUE.
        Returns:
        The resulting JSON string

      • findDownwards

        public <E extends Entity> E findDownwards(org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.util.List<E>> rChildAttribute,
                                          de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<? super E> pCriteria)
        Searches for a child entity in a hierarchy of children that matches a certain predicate. If the given children are not hierarchical only the flat list of children will be searched. This method is based on the EntityManager.findDownwards(List, RelationType, Predicate) method.
        Parameters:
        rChildAttribute - The child attribute to search and descend hierarchically
        pCriteria - The predicate to evaluate the children with
        Returns:
        The first matching child or NULL if none could be found

      • format

        public java.lang.String format()
        Invokes EntityFunctions.format(Entity) on this instance.
        Returns:
        A formatted string representation of this entity

      • getChild

        public <C extends PeriodEntity> C getChild(org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.util.List<C>> rChildAttr,
                                           java.util.Date rDate,
                                           de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<? super C> pExtraCriteria,
                                           boolean bUpwards)
        Returns a child that is valid on a certain date. The child must be a subclass of PeriodEntity to support the date check.
        Parameters:
        rChildAttr - The child attribute to search for
        rDate - The date to return the child for
        pExtraCriteria - An optional predicate to check valid children with or NULL for none
        bUpwards - TRUE to look upwards in the hierarchy if not found in this entity
        Returns:
        The matching child or NULL if none could be found

      • getChildHierarchy

        public <C extends Entity> java.util.List<C> getChildHierarchy(org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.util.List<C>> rChildAttribute,
                                                              de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<? super C> pCriteria)
        Returns the hierarchy of all or certain children of this entity. The returned list will contain all of this entity's direct and indirect children of the given attribute. If the predicate parameter is not NULL only children will be returned of which the predicate evaluation yields TRUE. If the evaluation of a certain child is FALSE it's own children will still be evaluated.

        The returned list will never be NULL and can be manipulated freely.

        Parameters:
        rChildAttribute - The attribute of the children to return
        pCriteria - The optional criteria or NULL for all children
        Returns:
        The list of children

      • getDefinition

        public EntityDefinition<?> getDefinition()
        Returns the entity definition for this entity class.
        Returns:
        The entity definition

      • getExtraAttribute

        public <T> T getExtraAttribute(org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rKey,
                               T rDefaultValue)
                        throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Returns the value of a certain extra attribute of this entity.
        Parameters:
        rKey - The key that identifies the attribute
        rDefaultValue - The default value to return if no extra attribute with the given key exists
        Returns:
        The attribute value or the default value if the attribute is not set
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If retrieving the extra attributes of this entity fails

      • getExtraAttributeFor

        public <T> T getExtraAttributeFor(Entity rOwner,
                                  org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rKey,
                                  T rDefaultValue,
                                  boolean bFallback)
                           throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Returns the value of an extra attribute of this entity for a certain owner entity.
        Parameters:
        rOwner - The owner entity of the extra attribute
        rKey - The key that identifies the attribute
        rDefaultValue - The default value to return if no extra attribute with the given key exists
        bFallback - TRUE to return the default extra attribute if no attribute for the given owner exists; FALSE to just return the default value
        Returns:
        The attribute value or the default value if the attribute is not set
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If querying the extra attribute fails

      • getExtraAttributes

        public java.util.Collection<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>> getExtraAttributes()
                                                                        throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Returns the keys of the extra attributes that are set on this entity. The values of the extra attribute can then be queried through the method getExtraAttribute(RelationType, Object). The returned collection can be modified freely by the caller.
        Returns:
        A collection of the current extra attribute keys
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If retrieving the extra attributes of this entity fails

      • getExtraAttributeUpwards

        public <T> T getExtraAttributeUpwards(org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rTypedKey)
                               throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Returns an extra attribute value from the hierarchy of this entity. If the value of the given relation type is NULL in this entity it will be looked up recursively in the parent of the same type (i.e. with the same entity definition) if such exists.
        Parameters:
        rTypedKey - The extra attribute key
        Returns:
        The extra attribute value
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If retrieving the extra attributes of this entity fails

      • getParent

        public Entity getParent()
        Returns the parent entity of this entity if available. This will either be the hierarchy parent or, if it is NULL and a master attribute is present, the master entity.
        Returns:
        The parent entity or NULL if this entity has no parent or if none is set

        Returns:
        The previous value (may be NULL)

      • getRoot

        public Entity getRoot()
        Returns the root parent of this entity's hierarchy. This will either be the topmost parent of the same entity type or, if a master attribute is present, the master entity.
        Returns:
        The root parent of this entity

      • getTypeAttribute

        public org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.Enum<?>> getTypeAttribute()
        Returns the type attribute of this entity.
        Returns:
        The type attribute

      • getUpwards

        public <T> T getUpwards(org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rType)
        Returns an attribute value from the hierarchy of this entity. If the value of the given relation type is NULL in this entity it will be looked up recursively in the parent of the same type (i.e. with the same entity definition) if such exists.
        Parameters:
        rType - The relation type of the attribute to return the value of
        Returns:
        The attribute value (NULL if not set in the hierarchy)

      • getXA

        public <T> T getXA(org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rKey,
                   T rDefaultValue)
        A shortcut for getExtraAttribute(RelationType, Object) that converts storage exception into runtime exceptions. Extra attributes should typically be accessible as their entity has obviously already been retrieved from the storage so the exception handling is normally superfluous. Nonetheless developers need to be aware that accessing an extra attribute also can cause a storage access (at least for the first XA).
        See Also:
        getExtraAttribute(RelationType, Object)

      • hasChangeLogging

        public boolean hasChangeLogging()
        Checks whether changes to this entity should be logged the history is enabled. The default implementation returns TRUE unless the relation EntityRelationTypes.SKIP_NEXT_CHANGE_LOGGING is set on this instance. This flag will be removed when this entity is stored with EntityManager.storeEntity(Entity, Entity, boolean).
        Returns:
        TRUE if history change logging is enabled for this entity

      • removeChild

        public <C extends Entity> void removeChild(org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.util.List<C>> rChildAttr,
                                           C rChild)
        Convenience method to remove a single child from this entity.
        See Also:
        removeChildren(RelationType, List)

      • removeChildren

        public <C extends Entity> void removeChildren(org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.util.List<C>> rChildAttr,
                                              java.util.List<C> rChildren)
        Removes child entities from this entity. This will set the parent references in the children to NULL. It is recommended that entity children are always removed through this method unless an entity subclass implements (and documents) more specific methods for the management of child entities. ATTENTION: it is important that the children to be removed are either actual children of this entity or are equals according to the implementation of equals(Object).

        To perform an update of the detached children that are no longer contained in this instances list of children they will be added to the relation EntityRelationTypes.DEPENDENT_STORE_ENTITIES so that they will be updated when this entity is stored.

        Parameters:
        rChildAttr - The attribute that references the child type
        rChildren - The new child objects to add to this entity
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If one of the parameters is invalid or if one of the children is already stored in this entity

      • reset

        public void reset()
           throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Resets the persistent state and removes all modifications markers on this entity by invoking EntityManager.resetEntity(Entity) on this instance. This will also restore the persistent state of this entity including it's children. Invoking code should therefore not longer hold references to children of this entity but instead read them from the parent after the reset if necessary.

        This method will only reset

        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If restoring the persistent state fails

      • resetHierachy

        public void resetHierachy()
                   throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Resets all modifications of this entity and it's hierarchy by invoking reset() on this instance and clearing modification markers on children held by the EntityManager. This will also restore the persistent state of this entity including it's children. Invoking code should therefore not longer hold references to children of this entity but instead read them from the parent after the reset if necessary.
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If restoring the persistent state fails

      • setExtraAttribute

        public <T> void setExtraAttribute(org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rKey,
                                  T rValue)
                           throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Stores an extra attribute of this entity. If an attribute with the given key already exists it will be updated, otherwise a new attribute will be created.
        Parameters:
        rKey - The key that identifies the attribute
        rValue - The value of the new attribute
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If retrieving the extra attributes of this entity fails

      • setExtraAttributeFor

        public <T> void setExtraAttributeFor(Entity rOwner,
                                     org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rKey,
                                     T rValue,
                                     Entity rChangeOrigin)
                              throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Sets an extra attribute for this entity with a certain owner entity. Other than setExtraAttribute(RelationType, Object) this method directly stores the new or modified extra attribute to avoid the need for caching. Caching is not necessary because owner-specific extra attributes are typically used less often than standard extra attributes.
        Parameters:
        rOwner - The owner of the extra attribute
        rKey - The key that identifies the attribute
        rValue - The value of the extra attribute
        rChangeOrigin - The entity that caused this change
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If querying for an existing extra attribute fails

      • setHierarchical

        public <T> void setHierarchical(org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rAttribute,
                                T rValue,
                                de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<? super Entity> pCriteria)
        Sets a certain attribute value in all entities of this entity's hierarchy, including this parent entity. If a criteria predicate is given only the entities for which the predicate evaluation yields TRUE will have the attribute value set.
        Parameters:
        rAttribute - The attribute to set
        rValue - The attribute value
        pCriteria - Optional criteria for the entities affected or NULL for all

      • setHierarchyImmutable

        public void setHierarchyImmutable()
        Makes the hierarchy of this entity immutable by setting the flag MetaTypes.IMMUTABLE recursively on this entity and it's children (but not on other entity relations).

Extra attributes should typically be accessible as their entity has obviously already been retrieved from the storage so the exception handling is normally superfluous.       • toPredicate

        public <E extends Entity> de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<E> toPredicate(boolean bIgnoreNullValues)
        Creates a Predicate from this entity using the current attribute values and the Predicates.equalTo(Object) method to construct it.

        The attribute EntityRelationTypes.ENTITY_ID is always ignored!

        Parameters:
        bIgnoreNullValues - If TRUE attribute values that are NULL are ignored when building the Predicate
        Returns:
        A Predicate from this entity using the current attribute values and the Predicates.equalTo(Object) method.

      • toPredicate

        public <E extends Entity> de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<E> toPredicate(boolean bIgnoreNullValues,
                                                                           org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>... rAttributes)
        Creates a Predicate from this entity using the current attribute values for the given attributes and the Predicates.equalTo(Object) method to construct it.
        Parameters:
        bIgnoreNullValues - If TRUE attribute values that are NULL are ignored when building the Predicate
        rAttributes - The attributes to use.
        Returns:
        A Predicate from this entity using the current attribute values for the given attributes and the Predicates.equalTo(Object) method.

      • unlock

        public void unlock()
        Tries to release a modification lock on this entity. The lock must have been acquired previously with lock() by the same context (process, thread).
        Throws:
        ConcurrentEntityModificationException - If the entity lock is not held by the current context (which can only happen if locking calls are handled incorrectly)

      • verifyAttribute

        public <T> void verifyAttribute(org.obrel.core.RelationType<? super T> rAttr,
                                T rValue)
        Checks whether an attribute of this instance has a defined value and throws an exception if that values is not equal to the given value. If the current value is not set or NULL no exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        rAttr - The attribute to test
        rValue - The value to check the attribute value against
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the attribute value differs from the given value

        Returns a description of this entity. The default implementation returns the result of Object.toString() but subclasses may override this method to change or modify the result.
        Returns:
        The entity description
